data.title: Always mentioned but unseen characters in tv shows , name them here
data.text:
Mrs Columbo

Captain Mainwaringâ€™s wife

There is an episode of her on one of the Columbo dvd's series.

Ruined it for me as she was an awful woman. Wish I had never watched it.

Its not part of the Columbo TV series and was pretty much disowned by all concerned. I think they rebranded to try and move away from the Columbo link which didn't really fit.

In the Columbo series you never see his wife.

I remember hearing that in one episode of the rebooted series that started in 1989 Lt Columbo talked about some woman that had been going around pretending to be his wife

0

Kerrys mum in This Country. I love her shes so funny always shouts to kerry from her bedroom.

Similar to one of the little britain sketches where david walliams comes into a shop , book shop i think run by Matt Lucas. Walliams asks a question and Lucas doesnt know the answer so he shouts up to his wife who answers.

Similar to Jack Dee's sitcom Bad Move, where the shopkeeper repeats everything Kerry Godliman says to her husband in the back, and we hear his answer but never see him.

1

Mr Swaineyâ€™s mother in One Foot in the Grave

My first thought when I saw the thread title.

When he used to shout up at the bedroom window to her, I sometimes wondered if he had her corpse in there and was pretending she was still alive or she was just a figment of his imagination ðŸ˜³ðŸ˜ƒ

0

Mr Swaineyâ€™s mother in One Foot in the Grave

My first thought when I saw the thread title.

When he used to shout up at the bedroom window to her, I sometimes wondered if he had her corpse in there and was pretending she was still alive or she was just a figment of his imagination ðŸ˜³ðŸ˜ƒ

Margarets mother came to stay in one episode also didn't she but we never saw or heard her either. I suppose as she lived away then it was more understandable we never saw her but she was often mentioned and was often on the phone etc to margaret

Come to think of it after her death we heard her answer phone message

0

The other of the Grace siblings in Are You Being Served.

Dennis Potter's 'Blue Remembered Hills' has a character, the alpha male of the children's gang, referred to several times by the other actors but who is never seen, can't remember the name.

0

I always thought it would be fun to get all the descriptions of Maris from Fraiser and give it to a police artist and find out what she would look like

0

Vera, Norm's wife in Cheers.

Yes and no. We saw her just not her face when she went around to Carla's for Thanksgiving and got a face full of cake. I think she was played by George Wendt's real wife.

0

The other of the Grace siblings in Are You Being Served.

Dennis Potter's 'Blue Remembered Hills' has a character, the alpha male of the children's gang, referred to several times by the other actors but who is never seen, can't remember the name.

Old Mr Grace, played by Kenneth Waller in eight episodes.

Oddly enough it was obvious (even with make up to make the actor look old) he looked about 20 years younger than Young Mr Grace.

0

I was going to say the General in "Dastardly & Mutley". But you did see his fist coming out of the telephone and slapping Dick Dastardly.

2

The good life had Mrs dooms-patterson and miss mountshaft.

Miss Cathcart in hi de hi

Sheridan in keeping up appearances

Joyce in hollyoaks

I love an unseen character

we never saw Joe Maplin either - in HI Di Hi

He does appear on screen in one early episode, but his face is never shown. The idea is that he's visiting the camp in disguise, pretending to be a camper, to carry out a secret inspection. Ted and Spike see him returning to his car and being driven out, and it's mostly only his trouser legs and shoes that are shown of him.

0

Did we ever see Sheridan Bucket?

Thankfully not. I have my own image of what he looks like (he has a monacle and wears plus fours) which is completely wrong, but i wouldnt like it ruined

2
